Comment: >we're getting them out legally  I'm not so sure about this. Yes, he's cloaking the deportations and lack of due process under the Alien Enemies Act, but it's really not clear that this is a legal invocation of the Act. It can be invoked in times of war or when a foreign nation threatens or undertakes an invasion of America. Neither of these things have happened. Trump's framing of South American immigration as an "invasion" [failed to pass judicial scrutiny today](https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/immigration/trump-appointed-federal-district-judge-rejects-use-alien-enemies-act-v-rcna204150) (May 1) in a Texas federal court, of all jurisdictions.  So, no. So long as it is deporting them without due process, the government is not getting them out *legally*.

Comment: I don't know if that's really true. It's a lot easier if you rail against the current administration, then you can rant about everything going wrong and you have zero responsibility. So the best for Rogan would be saying he supports Trump, but if Kamala actually won, then he could keep doing the exact same thing.  However as soon as the opposition guy wins, the guy you supposedly supported, now you're on the hook for everything the new administration does, so you're an apologist now for anything that goes wrong, reacting to each story as it appears rather than setting the agenda.  It's just far easier to be against stuff in some vague way, when you're not required to provide any answers, or defend what's happening.
